meanings.definition: To make slightly wet or damp before using.
meanings.sent1: Before baking, premoisten the dry ingredients with a little water.
meanings.sent2: The recipe instructed to premoisten the soil before planting the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to premoisten the flour to avoid a dry cake.
meanings.sent4: She gently premoistened the cloth before wiping the table clean.
meanings.sent5: Remember to premoisten the sponge before applying the paint for better coverage.

meanings.sent1: To ensure even cooking, premoisten the meat before grilling.
meanings.sent2: The gardener premoistened the soil to prepare for planting flowers.
meanings.sent3: The hiker premoistened his lips before embarking on the long trek.
meanings.sent4: The artist premoistened the canvas before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: It is important to premoisten the clay before shaping it into pottery.
